column2: OHIO DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column8: Merging traffic
column10: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed

column2: 3. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: stay in their lane.
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 5. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Stop

column2: 7. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 8. The sign in the picture:
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: Road work ahead

column2: 10. This sign means:
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column8: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 11. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 12. When drivers see this road sign:
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 13. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: go to work.

column2: 14. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: Construction and maintenance warning.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 16. This sign means:
column8: U-turns are not allowed.

column2: 17. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 19. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column8: School crossing

column2: 20. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Warning signs

column2: 21. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column8: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 22. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 23. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 24. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 25. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column6: before the traffic light turns red.
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 26. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Turn on your cruise control.
column10: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 27. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: wait for the next green light.

column2: 28. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 29. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column6: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column8: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column10: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.

column2: 30. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 31. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
32. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 33. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column8: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column10: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control

column2: 34. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column8: steer right

column2: 35. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 36. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 37. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 38. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column6: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 39. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 40. Who is most at risk?
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
